Title: Practitioner Capstone Course I
Description: This is the first course in a two part sequence. This course provides a framework for advancing skills and knowledge as a practitioner researcher. Using continuous inquiry, students will explore the role of practitioners as agents of change. Examples of the implementation of various research methods and models for the effective use of data will be explored. By the end of the course, the student will have identified a topic of concern, problem statement, and research questions.
Prerequisites: EDU 780 [Min Grade: B], EDEX 631 [Min Grade: B] (Can be taken Concurrently)

Title: Practitioner Capstone Course II
Description: This is the second course in a two-part sequence. In this course, methodology for information gathering will be discussed and students will implement appropriate methods for gaining information and engaging with other practitioners. This course culminates in a profession product including a review and analysis of literature.
Prerequisites: EDUP 780 [Min Grade: B] (Can be taken Concurrently)
